title: 108_s1439
content: The "Adoption Incentive Program Reauthorization Act of 2003" may be cited as the short title. Adoption incentive payments are addressed in the Act. The Adoption Incentive Program Reauthorization Act of 2003, also known as the Adoption Incentive Program, is amended to extend funding for fiscal years 2004 through 2008. The Act adjusts the baseline for determining the number of adoptions. The Adoption Incentive Program is amended to determine foster child adoptions based on data from fiscal years 2004 through 2008. Adoption incentive payment is increased to $6,000 per adoption. The Adoption Incentive Program is amended to define "older child adoption" as the final adoption of a child aged 9 or older who was in foster care or has an adoption assistance agreement. The term 'base number of older child adoptions for a State' is defined as the number of older child adoptions in the State in specific fiscal years. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to the Health insurance coverage for children with special needs under the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to change data requirements for states seeking grants under specific fiscal years. The definition of base number of foster child adoptions is also revised. The Social Security Act is amended to change data requirements for states seeking grants under specific fiscal years. The Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is also amended to adjust discretionary caps for certain fiscal years. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to adjust discretionary caps for specific fiscal years, increasing the amount from $20,000,000 to $43,000,000. The amendments take effect on October 1, 2003.
